meanings.definition: The quality of being commensurable or capable of being measured or compared.
meanings.sent1: The commensurability of the ingredients in the recipe ensures a balanced flavor.
meanings.sent2: The commensurability of the two sides of the equation allows for easy comparison.
meanings.sent3: The commensurability of the clown's shoes with his tiny car made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The commensurability of her kindness to a warm hug made her a beloved figure in the community.
meanings.sent5: The commensurability of the puzzle pieces made it satisfying to complete.

meanings.definition: The state of having a common measure or being in proportion.
meanings.sent1: The commensurability of the furniture in the room created a harmonious atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The commensurability of the team members' skills led to a successful project.
meanings.sent3: The commensurability of the cat's meows to the size of its body was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The commensurability of his excitement to a bursting balloon showed how happy he was.
meanings.sent5: The commensurability of the colors in the painting made it visually appealing.
